alert.note: Alert for Coastal Jefferson; Lower Plaquemines (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 6:21PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Jefferson and Plaquemines Parishes through 715 PM CDT... At 620 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a waterspouts over marine areas. These storms were located along a line extending from 11 miles south of Myrtle Grove to 12 miles northwest of Burrwood. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts up to 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Port Sulphur, Myrtle Grove, Boothville-venice, Boothville, Pointe A La Hache, Empire, Buras, Buras-triumph, Venice and Boothville Asos. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
